sect1.title: J2KProcessInterception
sect1.subtitle: A component for calculation of interception.

row.entry: calibration parameter for interception of liquid precipitation
calibration parameter for interception of frozen precipitation

sect2.title: Component Description
sect2.para: The interception module calculates the throughfalls of field precipitation dependent on the corresponding vegetative cover and its value in the seasonal cycle. The field precipitation is reduced by the interception rate to the throughfall (via interception). Hence throughfall only occurs when the maximum interception storage capacity of a vegetation is exhausted. The excess precipitation is transferred as falling precipitation to the subsequent module. The maximum interception capacity (Int max) is calculated in J2000 according to the following formula:

listitem.para: storage capacity per m² leaf area subject to the type of precipitation [mm]
leaf area index of specific land use class

sect2.para:
example image
The parameter α has a certain value dependent on the type of intercepted precipitation (rain or snow) since the maximum interception capacity of snow is significantly higher than that of liquid precipitation. The leaf area index for the individual vegetation types in the seasonal cycle is calculated according to the above-mentioned method for each day of the time span. The emptying of the inception storage is exclusively carried out by evaporation. A special case occurs when the value of the parameter α changes from snow to rain because of air temperature. This leads to a sudden decrease of the maximum interception storage capacity. Potential excess precipitation is transferred as drip precipitation to the subsequent module.
